intro: Thelypodiopsis barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's lepidote, is a rare and endemic species of flowering plant found primarily in the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, small, ovate leaves, and clusters of pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
